channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Litter on Tabard street around clothes recycle bin, 6th December
item.description:
There are clothes left on the ground around the clothes recycling bin on Tabard street. It has been there for seven days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on Tabard street, 6th December
item.description:
There are cans, fast food packaging and paper on the pavement and on the planters on Tabard Street. It has been there for two days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, Greater London

item.title: Fly-tipping at Tabard Street, 6th December
item.description:
There is household items dumped on Tabard Street next to the planter. It has been there are three days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28-52, Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner of Linnell and Shenley Road regularly used as flytipping spot. Let’s set up a camera to catch the repeat offender., 6th December
item.description:
The corner of Linnell Road and Shenley Road is frequently used as a dumping /flytipping spot. This last week many blue bags of mattress stuffing left and then wind blue the stuffing all over the streets. I cleaned it up. As this is a repeat site, can we set up a camera to record the licence plates and identities of the culprits?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Shenley Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Fly tipping, 6th December
item.description:
Suitcases, black plastic bags full of rubbish dumped on pavement at base of tree and on opposite side of the road a cardboard box and packaging. This is a fly tipping hot spot. A camera was fitted because of this some time ago but it hasn't improved the situation. It's either a fake camera, not monitored or the council do not care what the borough looks like. There seems to be no deterrent. Weekly black bin collections need to be reinstated.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brodrick Grove, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain in the road outside Six by Nico 41 Charlotte St, W1, 6th December
item.description:
This drain has been blocked for a couple of months. We clear the leaves from the grate and it's still blocked. After heavy rain the water floods into the road and the water does not clear until rain has stopped for several days.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Charlotte Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building waste in ten black bags, 6th December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodland Walk, Greenwich

item.title: Parking issues, 6th December
item.description:
We have raised numerous complaints around the parking on clockhouse road when the CPZ ends at midday the road is full and makes resident parking impossible its worse at weekends complaints are just ignored by Bromley council and its councilors this is unfair on residents who pay for a permit and the area needs to be reviewed and the current times adjusted tje traffic and parking has got worse over the years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clock House Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
